fields.value: State Court Processing Statistics, 1990-2009: Felony Defendants in Large Urban Counties

authorName.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

authorAffiliation.value: United States Department of Justice. Office of Justice Programs. Bureau of Justice Statistics

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Originally known as the National Pretrial Reporting Program, the State Court Processing Statistics (SCPS) program tracks felony cases filed in May of a given year until final disposition or until one year has elapsed from the date of filing. This collection presents data on felony cases filed in approximately 40 of the nation's 75 most populous counties in even numbered years from 1990-2006 and 2009. These 75 counties account for more than a third of the United States population and
approximately half of all reported crimes. The cases from these 40 jurisdictions are weighted to represent all felony filings during the month of May in the 75 most populous counties. Data were collected on arrest charges, demographic characteristics, criminal history, pretrial release and detention, adjudication, and sentencing.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System

The title of the study has been revised to reflect the range of years the data were collected instead of individual years.;Version Date: 2004-05-20Version Text: 2004-05-20 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Documentation has been revised for Part 7, 2000 Data, and for Part 1, 1990-2000 Cumulative Data.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS, SPSS, and Stata setup files, SAS  transport (CPORT) file, SPSS system file, and tab-delimited ASCII data file;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Part 1, 1990-2009 Cumulative Data, has its own codebook, which is separate from the codebook for Part 10, 2006 Data. Parts 6, 7, and 8, 1998-2004 Data, also have their own codebooks. Parts 2-5, the 1990, 1992, 1994, and 1996 individual-year data files, share the same codebook.;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Part 6, 1998 Data, contains over 100 new variables that were created by the principal investigator.;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Parts 2-5, the 1990, 1992, 1994, and 1996 data files, were created from the 1990-1996 Cumulative Data file.;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: This version of the data supersedes all previous National Pretrial Reporting Program files.;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: Variable names and value labels have been made consistent across the 1990, 1992, 1994, 1996, 1998
, 2000, 2002, 2004, and 2006 files. All years use "8" codes for not applicable and "9" codes for missing data. Since some variables did not exist for all years, there may be instances in which all cases are missing for a variable within a given year.;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: There are 25 additional variables in Part 10, 2006 Data that are not in Part 1, 1990-2009 Cumulative Data.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Stata system file(s), SPSS portable file(s), rda Data file(s), sav Data file(s), stc Data file(s), tsv Data file(s), Data file(s), SAS transport - XPORT engine file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: Felony court filings during the month of May in even years from 1990-2006 and 2009 in the 75 most populous counties in the United States.

fields.value: In a two-stage sampling process, the first stage was a stratified sample to select 40 of the 75 most populous counties, and the second stage was a systematic sample of defendants based on felony filings within each selected county.
Checked for undocumented or out-of-range codes.
